availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: British diplomat. Native of Erskine, England. Son of Robert Walter Stuart. Entered diplomatic service in 1845, serving in Paris, Rio de Janiero, and Athens until 1861. British secretary of legation to the United States in Washington, D. C., from 1861 to 1863. Charge d'affaires for Her Majesty Queen Victoria in Washington, D. C. in 1863.

ab.bibl:
The National Archives, Kew "Sir William Stuart: Papers" http://discovery.nationalarchives.gov.uk/details/record?catid=10768&catln=3 (accessed September 18, 2018).
